Judul: STATE OF THE ART OF CO2 STORAGE GEOPHYSICAL TECHNOLOGY AND THE  PILOT STUDY IN GUNDIH FIELD, CENTRAL JAVA PROVINCE, INDONESIA
Abstrak:
This paper presents the state of the art of CO2 storage technology and the preliminary study of GeologyGeophysics-Reservoir (GGR) which is intended to determine the best CO2 storage around the Gundih field. This
preliminary study is the first stage from a research project of "Pilot Study for Carbon Sequestration and Monitoring in 
the Gundih field, Central Java Province, Indonesia", as a collaboration research between Indonesia and Japan. Whereas 
the second stage is the geophysical monitoring step to make sure that there is no CO2 leakages during and after injection 
is carried out. The expected outcome of the overall study is to provide guidance on the application of geophysical 
technology in determining the CO2 storage and monitoring as well as to increase the hydrocarbon production. The 
success of this study could then be applied to other fields in Indonesia.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: R.M. Rachmat Sule, Susanti Alawiyah, Darharta Dahrin
Kata Kunci: Pilot Study, CO2 storage, geophysical technology, GGR study
